response.overview: Following his great success with "North by Northwest," director Alfred Hitchcock makes a daring choice for his next project: an adaptation of Robert Bloch's novel "Psycho." When the studio refuses to back the picture, Hitchcock decides to pay for it himself in exchange for a percentage of the profits. His wife, Alma Reville, has serious reservations about the film but supports him nonetheless. Still, the production strains the couple's marriage.
response.tagline: Behind every Psycho is a great woman.
response.title: Hitchcock

titles.title: Alfred Hitchcock and the Making of Psycho
希区柯克与《精神病患者》
